comment: Professor used to teach history and clearly still thinks she does.We got 100 history lessons and maybe 3 about teaching. She doesn't give feedback on assignments (class suspects she doesn't look at submissions) and just tosses out 85's-93's. Obviously Liberal and teaches like her opinion is fact. Attendance is MANDATORY you can only miss 3 classes!

Awful time. Hard to reach outside of class with no feedback on assignments. Explanations were vague, passive-aggressive, and short. While the work for the class was relatively easy,  there was next to no guidance on assignments. Rarely related topics back to education.  This class is basically an online course with irrelevant discussion in class.

I would not take her as a professor. She teaches about how we can't discriminate against anyone especially in a class room yet if your views don't aline with hers then she will make your life hell and she does not email you back and she isn't understanding and makes class difficult

DO NOT TAKE IF YOU VALUE YOUR GRADES OR YOUR SANITY OR YOUR MENTAL HEALTH! This woman does NOT care about your success and I have no idea why she chose a path in teaching. Offers virtually zero guidance or support and does mediocre at best reviewing content. Wouldn't recommend to my worst enemy.

I went through agony in this class. Does not respond to emails unless you follow up, and her responses are so vague I got one-worded responses at times. Instructions on assignments were never clear, and no virtual office hours. She made a presumably easy class so difficult. Why is she a professor is my question. I got an A, but at what cost...
Her class itself wasn't the hardest but she has no desire to help her students out. She is very lazy when it comes to making and helping students figure out assignemnts. Also wont answer emails.

Do not take her class. She gives very vague instructions on online assignments and is very unwilling to help her students out through emails. She is the worst prof ive ever had and she is better off not being a professor at all. She will ignore your emails for days until you send 3/4 after.

There were few assignments in this course so that did not take up to much time. There was an assignment where you needed a partner. There were volunteer hours required (15 hours) which was a confusing process at first because the instructions seemed a bit unclear. However, once they were understood it went smoothly.
Professor Williams is a solid choice for a professor, take her if you can. She's pretty chill- one group project with a presentation, some papers, encourages class discussions.

We had three grades: two essays and a group project. Her guidelines are unclear, she'll cancel class and give us assignments but won't grade them. It's a waste of time, honestly. The course would be much more enjoyable with another instructor. Easy A but, take someone else if you actually want to learn.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Quality teacher with a fun personality. There are 2 reflection papers- 1 in the beginning of the semester and 1 at the end- that are tedious and single spaced, but other than that, speak up in her class, participate, and SPEAK YOUR MIND! Subjects talked about are touchy but she wants honest opinions! Also finish your volunteer work or you wont pass
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Group projects

comment: Facilitates great discussion about current events. Show up and talk. Do the few assignments and get an A. Two big essays and no tests.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Amazing lectures

comment: Loved this professor. Awesome discussions.

Professor Williams has her student's think & question a lot of things that have become 'normal' for us as a society and as a country. She's humorous, patient, passionate about education, understanding, & gives few assignments. Some essays, a powerpoint, & movie review. Listen to the lectures, participate, and the class will be an easy A!

Professor Williams is one of my favorite professors so far. She encourages healthy debates and conversations in the classroom which I like a lot. She doesn't make us stay the whole class period which is also nice. But be ready to write papers!

Professor Williams is a great teacher and enjoys students who get involved. She is kind of slack on responding to emails or answering questions but she is also a high school teacher and I think those classes are more important to her. She is very straight forward but doesn't mind joking around with her students either. An enjoyable class.
Solid choice in textbook choice. Don't expect your hand to be held, she isn't tough but she treats you like a college student. There aren't many assignments for the class and only a final exam.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Tests? Not many--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Professor Williams is passionate about many things but teaching EDUC2120 is not one of them. The whole class felt like a waste of time. Most of the class periods were spent presenting ONE project. A lot of in class discussions that you are required to participate in for class credit. I'm not sure I learned anything but it was an easy A.
I wish she taught other classes.  She is funny and down to earth and is very patient.  Wish other professors was like her.

Wish She taught other classes I really enjoyed this class.  I wish she taught other classes so I could take them with her.  She is very understanding-sometimes I think too much with a student who was not deserving of her patience.

Terrible Teacher, not understanding an bigoted about the issues she is presenting. Absolutely my least favorite professor at KSU. Almost failed me for a garbage reason that I had to appeal to the higher ups about.
This class opened my eyes to things I would typically miss on a daily basis.  very important class for everyone not just teachers.  Great Professor...

I ran into some problems during the semester and this professor really did go out of her way to help me.  She can't help if you don't communicate with her.  I love her-she is very patient.  Great class.  Work load not bad at all.

Didn't have a lot of test-more projects.  Provided review guide for final exam. Amazing lectures- I've learned soooo much.   Some students were annoying and she was super patient.  She made me see things I never really paid attention to before.  I would definitely recommend this class.

although she is a wonderful teacher, we basically spent the entire semester with group projects, granted we only met once a week for 2 1/2 hours. Only one test, which is the final exam, short answer questions. 2 papers in the midst of that 1 group project and one presentation, which we had a week to do but it took 9 weeks to present every group
Hands down a great class.
This Professor was very helpful to me.  She always made herself available when needed and responded to all emails quickly.  Definitely recommend.  Love her!
Love it!
Excellent teacher! Very helpful & enjoyed her class.
